However, it is more agreeable to my disposition to suppose that Prince's intervention actually restored him to his former situation3 especially since he so often had even the honour of a statue decreed to him by thosea who could not be ignorant of the sentence which the Proconsul Paulus pronounced upon him. Butl do not mean to intimate by this, my dear Pliny, that if any new charge should be brought against him, you should be less disposed to hear his accusers. l have examined the memorial of his prosecutrix, Furia Prima, as also that of Archippus himself, which you · sent with your former letter.
